multiple_choice_question.text: This table summarizes the time complexity of optimal matroid partitioning problems. Which of the following statements is **incorrect** based on the information presented in the table?
choices: The minimum (Σ, Σ)-value matroid partitioning problem can be solved in polynomial time for both general and identical cases.
The minimum (max, Σ)-value matroid partitioning problem is strongly NP-hard for both general and identical cases.
The minimum (∑, max)-value matroid partitioning problem has a PTAS only in the identical case.
The minimum (max, min)-value matroid partitioning problem has a polynomial-time algorithm for the general case.

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula defines the objective function for the minimum (Op(1), Op(2))-value matroid partitioning problem. Which mathematical operation does this formula represent?
choices: Summation of the minimum weight of elements in each partition set.
Applying Op(1) to the results of applying Op(2) on the weights of elements within each partition set.
Applying Op(2) to the results of applying Op(1) on the weights of elements within each partition set.
Multiplication of the maximum weight of elements in each partition set.
